item.title: The Battle of Neighborhood: Starting a Coffee Shop Business
item.description: Built a k-means clustering model in Python and Scikit-Learn to find the best location for starting a coffe shop business in Toronto city. Scrapped over 100 Toronto postal codes and 10 boroughs from Wikipedia using Python and Beautiful Soup; transformed it into a Pandas dataframe. Defined neighborhoods based on their postal codes and retrieved the coordinate (latitude and longitude) for each using Geocoder module. Analyzed the pedestrian and vehicle volumes from the Toronto Open Data; visualized it using Folium, leading to 139 lively / busiest roads.

item.title: Wind Energy Forecasting Model based on Deep Learning
item.description: Led a 3-member team to build time series forecasting models for energy traders in 4 weeks boot camp using neural networks in Smojo. Engineered the features by using DIFF window, combined with momentum, force, and statistical attributes to help the model perform better prediction. Optimized the difference neural networks with input scaling subnet, dropout layer, and L2 regularization; achieved MAE/MSE of 0.5/0.3 using test loss while having no lag. Deployed the model and performed CI/CD using Autocaffe Labs; maximized revenue over 1-week trading by producing a net profit of 8.
